text: @Plasmadreamer @Blacky_Himself @EnvAgency We can't deny they bought benefits when they were first introduced, but a lot has changed since then in terms of population size and developments in technology. They just aren't good enough anymore.

@harrietalvis @Blacky_Himself @EnvAgency Combined sewerage systems are employed in urban areas throughout Europe. Their development brought massive public health benefits to the general population. The users of the system however repeatedly abuse the asset (FOG wipes etc) which cause havoc with CSO‚Äôs.

@Abbie200974 @EnvAgency Hi Abbie, we‚Äôre sorry to hear this. Please could you DM us your full address, postcode and a contact number so we can arrange to send someone out to help? Thanks.
@EnvAgencySE Thank you for the reply, reported and all ok for now.
Another rainy day and more sewage floating up through our drain @wessexwater maybe at some point you‚Äôll fix it? Or do we have to cope with a 2nd winter of this??@EnvAgency https://t.co/1Lp69eoZVj
RT @EnvAgencyNW: Due to forecasted heavy rain we have deployed Phase 1 of the #Northwich Scheme & erected temporary defences at Barons Quay‚Ä¶

@Blacky_Himself @EnvAgency Also, as if they can claim that that is largely the only time discharges are occuring! Looking at the outfall data so many are discharging more than half the days of the year, there's no way you can class that many as heavy rainfall!
@RatcatcherMike @EnvAgency Sad to say all I've ever seen in and around the Chelt are rats.
